intro: Helosciadium falcaria, commonly known as the common cow-wheat, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Native to Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has a taproot system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along woodland edges.
